Reviews.Title: “Perfect for all our needs”
Reviews.Author: Tatz90
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Emerald Suites for 7 nights in April 2011. The hotel is opposite the Orleans which ran a free shuttle to the Strip. The pool and jacuzzi area was empty most of the time so we made the most of it! Free coffee in reception and free internet in the rooms. Rooms were cleaned daily and staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky, smelly, dirty, outdated, and overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: westrafters
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room based on the reviews we read here. Somewhere on the reservation website we missed ticking the box, "Non-smoking room." So we were given a room in an awful building that stunk of cigar and cigarette smoke. We were told there were no non-smoking rooms available and we hadn't noted the preference in our registration. So we were stuck. If we hadn't just flown for 24 hours from Europe to LV, we would have gone elsewhere. In addition, the carpets were filthy--especially in the hallways--the bathrooms had dirt and debris in all the cracks and corners and there were no elevators to the rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floors. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, great prices, awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: Gusgus88
Reviews.Content: I’ve booked a room for the first time in October 2010 and for the second time this past weekend. I have had good experiences both times. The only thing I can complain is their beds. They tend to be a bid hard. This was experienced on both of my trips. Other than that, the rooms were in great shape, clean and spacious. Their desk service is superb, friendly and helpful. The amenities are a great plus for the low rates they offer. This makes it easy to save some extra cash if you do not want to be eating out at the strip all day. Getting to the strip from there is easy and hassle free. I hope the beds get upgraded in the near future which will make the experience a great one!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: TANSTFL2
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights for a business conference and definitely would stay again. After reading some of the other reviews, I was a little leary and this place does have some minor drawbacks but overall I thought it was a great value. First the drawbacks: like most apartments the lighting is dim. There are a ceiling lights in the kitchen and bathroom but only table lamps in the living room and bedrooms. The internet is wired and the outlet in in the living room so bring your long ethernet cable. The TV is also in the living room (none in the bedrooms). No elevators. But for the price, I gladly can accept these minor limitations. I had a full kitchen with dining table, dishes, dishwasher, refridgerator, microwave, separate bedroom for the same price (or less) than a regular hotel room. I found the front desk staff to be very friendly (they have a workstation with printer where you can print out your boarding pass in the front office). I got a quiet nights sleep every night (and I am a light sleeper).My AC unit worked perfectly. I thought the location is great (I took a short walk over to the Orleans a few times to gamble). I probably saved more on meals by hitting the Albertson's grocery store which is close by than the entire cost of the room. The daily maid service was great - they even put my dirty dishes in the dishwasher for me. Of course, being a single guy, I only used the microwave and didn't attempt any serious cooking. Overall, I thought it was a great place to stay and would definitely check it out the next time I'm back in Vegas. If you are looking for a luxury spot on the strip this is probably not the place for you but I had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITLY NEEDS UPDATING!!!”
Reviews.Author: dudesoy
Reviews.Content: We were surprised when we opened our door to see a huge stain on the carpet. The maids didnt see that? Website states "Our suites come with fully stocked kitchens perfect for cooking your own meals", there are absolutly no pots & pans no dishrags, dishsoap or dishwasher soap. Kinda hard to cook, it has 4 plates, 4 cups 4 bowls and silverware for 4. Tiles in kitchen and bath all cracked and broken. need serious updating. When guests stay 3 plus days would be nice to have laundry basket in room. hard to wlk down 3 flights of stairs and over 3 buildings w/dirty clothes. Small loveseat in LR and only one tv in 2 bedroom suite. hard to relax after a long day! Free high speed internet/make sure you bring a plug in so you dont have to buy one like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Could Want Except For A Soft Bed”
Reviews.Author: EggsBaconandHash
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place to stay. I am actually writing this review with my laptop attached to the free high speed internet. Other guest have been nice and long term residents seem quiet. We are pretty loud on halloween and we asked nicely to quiet down. So far so Good!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: TravelingwBuddies
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here with another couple. We had plenty of room to stay in the 2 bedroom suite for the four of us. Basically only used the suite to come back after a day on the Strip. Found it was reasonably clean (as much as a hotel can be). Internet access worked decently. Laundry facilities were neat. Service was very good. Front desk was always pleasant and helpful. Best part was the Orleans across the road has shuttle service (about 15 min ride to Strip). Was nice to be in the quiet after a long day on the Strip. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Meets our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: CurlyQLV
Reviews.Content: We come to Las Vegas every June for a week of meetings. This hotel is perfect for us due to location, value, size of suite, and availability of a kitchenette. It is located across from a casino and has lots of businesses within easy reach. It is safe and works well for us. We will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend! Esp for families”
Reviews.Author: 19Becks75
Reviews.Content: Great staff and service - ended up staying for a month. Front desk is helpful and friendly. Quick response to our two issues - both very minor and both repaired immediately and right the first time (that is over a month). The property is clean and well maintained. We commented many times during our stay that we appreciated how clean and quiet the property is. We would recommend this location to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Just Simply Gross”
Reviews.Author: hazelygirl
Reviews.Content: I have never taken the time to write a review before but felt that in this case it is warranted. I want to keep someone from making the mistake we made. This motel was a disaster. The rooms smelled like a combination of cigarettes and mildew. The air conditioner froze so we asked for another room and the same thing happened again and a third time as well. The front desk clerks clearly hated their jobs and made no attempt to hide it from the long line of customers during check in. The hot tub had cigarette butts floating in it and smelled like a fish tank. It was a holiday weekend so there were no other rooms in town. We hated every second we were there. I will gladly pay anything the next time we are in Vegas to avoid a room that I felt was filthy and service that made me feel like I was intruding. There were alot of long term customers and they seemed to be one step away from transients. If you are traveling with your family DO NOT STAY in this hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: jmglick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Emerald Suites Cameron for four nights for a combination conference and vacation. The motel is a converted apartment building, so the units all have one or two bedrooms, a living room and kitchen. There are also coin-op washers and dryers available, The pool is open every evening until 10 pm (much later than at most Las Vegas hotels). We loved our stay here! I'd like to address a couple issues raised by previous people who posted on this site: 1) Do you need a car if you stay here? The answer is absolutely "no". First of all, the Emerald Suites provide a free shuttle to and from the airport. We arrived at about 9:00 pm and the shuttle was there to pick us up about 15 minutes after we called - very good service. During the day there is a schedule, so you might have to leave a little earlier than you would if you were to take a taxi, but you can't beat the price - free. But what about getting over to the Strip after you arrive? No problem! You just walk across the street to the Orleans hotel (I know it's hot, but you can do it) and take the free shuttle to Bill's Gambling Hall on the Strip and/or the Gold Coast, which happens to be right across the street from the Rio (where our convention was being held). 2) This place is very well maintained. Everything was clean and orderly. The bed was comfortable and internet connection very fast (they will loan you a cable - it's not WiFi, but it's free). We got this place as part of a package deal on Priceline - it hardly cost us any more than the price of airfare alone. I highly recommend Emerald Suites Cameron.

Reviews.Title: “So So So IMPRESSED”
Reviews.Author: SDV12
Reviews.Content: I booked Emerald Suites after deciding to travel to Vegas to job hunt. I needed extended stay accomodations for 13 nights. I found Emerald Suites on a booking site and then did some research on different review sites. All reviews indicated it was a great place to stay and it most certainly was. The staff was the friendliest. They need to open up a friendly school for others to learn from. Everyone (employee) I encountered was very polite and friendly. My apartment was immaculate when I checked in...I mean CLEAN...The grounds were immaculate there was someone everday taking care of the grounds. The parking lot is well lit and felt secure. The "suite" entries are internal and you must have a key to get in. I am a female who was alone and felt VERY secure here....Its a great great place...Close to the strip, grocery stores, freeway, centrally located,,,Just a fantastic place...I'm in the hotel industry therefore I don't gush about places....This was a fantastic place...I got a job and am now moving to Vegas and will not hesitate to recommend maybe even DEMAND my family and friends stay here when they visit if the hotel I am going to work at cannot accomodate them...Special thanks to Bianca at Emerald Suites....She was wonderful towards me...Look no further this is your place....

Reviews.Title: “Big room, low prices, happy customer!”
Reviews.Author: bradleypariah
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I aren't cheap, but frugal. I found this place online and took a chance on it, despite it's alarmingly low price. When we arrived, we were just floored. Our room had a family room with a couch and TV, a full-featured separate kitchen, separated bedroom, and a stand-alone full bathroom. My goodness. I WILL NEVER STAY ANYWHERE ELSE AGAIN. If you're made of plastic and you're looking for a home theater built-in to a room the size of a pizza box for $200 a night right on the strip, this place is not for you. It's a fully furnished apartment-style suite with everything someone might need. There is a free shuttle to the strip available within walking distance. This is THE way to experience Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: qbluehorse
Reviews.Content: It's located close to the strip. Very nice & quiet rooms with everything you need. Including the internet. It was basically like having an apartment a block from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “VERY FRIENDLY PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: philipr144
Reviews.Content: The lady who helped us at the front desk was very nice, cant remember her name for sure but i think it was Bianca. She got us right into our rooms and the whole process was seemless. Rooms were more like apartments. I went with 3 other people and sleeping arrangments were not a problem. Very close to Vegas attractions and parking was not an issue. Its a rocks throw away from a big casino and good places to eat. The trip went so much smoother because of our comfortable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: dailytraveller
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay for a great price. Off the strip so it's not noisy or busy. Not very fancy but very clean and the staff were amazing. Free shuttle bus to and from the airport. If you needed to go to the strip, the staff recommended going across the street to the Orleans hotel and casino and grabbing their complimentary shuttle to the strip at the Orleans sister hotel on the strip. They never asked if we were staying at the hotel. The unit we stayed in had a Kitchen unit it it so we made most of our meals. Only ate out once which really saved on money. Felt that the place was safe and secure. Definitely staying there again if we go as family. Most impressed with the staff. Like I said before they were very friendly and helpful. That by itself is worth lots.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great price”
Reviews.Author: jlynne59
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the Orleans across the way being booked on the day I needed, I got to stay at the Emerald Suites. In fact they suggested it. It was perfect. When booking, thought I picked the wrong property. When this was realized the staff did not hestiate to make the change with no issues or rudeness that other hotel staff would have done. Even the trip from the airport was great with a shuttle driver that was delightful, knowledgable and engaging. If you didn't know anything about Las Vegas, you everything about Las Vegas by the time you reached the property! I will be back at the Emerald and I will be taking friends and referring friends for their trip to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “average............. been to better............. been to worse”
Reviews.Author: angel90008
Reviews.Content: The price was reasonable for the accomodations of a two bed-room suite. The hotel was a little old. It smelled like smoke. Unfortuantely there was not wireless internet, but the hotel does provide the wire if you want to take advantage of the free internet option in the living room. There was no tvs in the bedrooms, only one in the living room. There was no elevators, which is bad for ppl like me who have a tendency to overpack. I guess the walss were thin, because I could heard all kinds of noises day and night. Great anmenities in the kitchen: full size refigerator, stove, microwave, toaster, dishwasher, dishes........... It was in a nice area, with lots of eating places nearby. Not that long of a drive from the strip. The hotel was ok. It all depends on your personal taste. I like fancy hotels, but I would consider this hotel again for my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - but a mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: ReasonRules
Reviews.Content: The Emerald Suites on Cameron is kind of a quirky place - likely a converted apartment building, instead of a purpose-built motel. I suspect this because of several things: - although the buildings are 3-story, they don't have elevators, which can be difficult for persons with mobility issues or a lot to lug around (and probably gives the housekeeping staff a good cardio workout!). I wound up on 3, but didn't mind since it meant no chance of some heavy-footed plodder above me. - the rooms aren't laid out like most "extended-stay" ones - they have separate bedrooms (without a phone - which can be a challenge) and large kitchens. - the finishes aren't motel-like, including the absence of drapes - or anything to hook them on (the importance of which is detailed below). That being said, my room was comfortable, with a trim-level akin to a discount chain (Red Roof, Econo-Lodge) and was waaay cheaper than the nearby Orleans (especially with their "activity/spa" fee and daily internet charges), where I was attending an event. There were, however, some issues that keep me from giving this facility an robust endorsement: 1) The internet service is via an ethernet("cat-5") cable, instead of wireless, and while it's free, the service was maddeningly inconsistent; constant stalling, failures to load pages, and response that frequently reminded me of the wonderful days of "dial-up". The staff tried resetting the server, which helped once, but the second time when it got no better I was advised that "if someone's downloading a movie it can get really slow". Great! I wasted a LOT of time trying to just do things like check e-mail or research attractions - if you need reliable service for work-related things there's a good chance you'll be pulling on your hair after a short time. They have some cables to lend, but the one I got was in bad shape. I originally thought it might be the issue, so I got one at Big Lots (just $4). 2) The lack of drapes (just blinds on the sliding balcony door and bedroom window) lead to a big surprise when I went to bed the first night; an annoying level of light leaking into the room (from the fixtures that illuminate the sidewalks between buildings). I could face the mirrored closet door and see myself - with the lights off! Luckily I could borrow a tablecloth and clips from a vendor friend at the event to cover the blinds. 3) My unit (and others, it appeared) had a noticeable gap at the bottom of the door; this increased hallway noise and meant that the smells of pan-fried chicken and charred toast wafted into my room (with the latter giving me a start - thought it might be a fire!). Got a towel from housekeeping to put across the threshold. 4) There's a business just north of the property that appears to do metal fabrication and feels compelled to bang a lot of large metal containers around very early in the morning - it sounded like a dumpster-truck driver training class! My room was on the south side, so I only noticed it on the days I was outside early - no issue if you're not sleeping past 8AM. I have to say that everyone I encountered on the staff was very pleasant and courteous - must've had a turnover from the staff from other reviews. As for that other reviewer's complaint about hot water - I take showers that only last about 4-5 minutes, and the water was ankle-deep in the tub when I was done. If you're still covered in soap 30 MINUTES into a warm/hot shower, you've got bigger issues to worry about - like avoiding bankruptcy from budget-busting home water heating bills! Just what a desert town needs - people taking 50-gallon showers!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: siumae2002
Reviews.Content: Loved the shuttle bus staff! 1st impression was a good one! The livingroom is nicely decorated! Kitchen very clean as well as the bathroom and bedrooms! The reception staff were friendly and helpful! The maid was helpful with extra coffee and soap/shampoo when we needed it. Loved the pool and hot tub! The hot tub was good and hot and the jets were great after a long day of walking and sight seeing! J. Connell, Hamilton, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Free Internet - You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: Sooke54
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Emerald Suites Cameron for 1 week stays in 2008 and 2009. It offers the features I'm looking for: 1. Unlike the casinos, I don't have to walk six miles to get from my car to the room. 2. It has much more room than a standard hotel room - a separate bedroom, kitchen, and small balcony. 3. It boasts the rarest of features in LV - free internet. Trouble is, the connection is either dead slow, or non-existent, especially during the evening hours, when other guests are sharing the line. Despite repeated calls to the front desk, the service never improved. It seems that with any hotel with free internet access, the front desk has a different method of accessing the internet than the guestrooms. The reason, I suspect, is that the front desk needs a rock-solid connection, which the guestroom internet service does NOT provide. So, I won't be staying here next trip. It's a shame, because the location is right across from the Orleans, which offers a shuttle to the strip. For those not concerned with internet access, The Emeralds Suites Cameron provides basic accommodation. I paid around $50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Roomy and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Dietitianwest
Reviews.Content: This place is like the "residence" hotels with kitchens, bedrooms, living area. The kitchen was fully equipped! Great for people with young children who might want to have snacks or meals in the room. We wanted a separate room (with a door) for our 28 year old visiting with us. Place is a little worn, but not noisy or smelly like a lot of the Vegas Strip or off strip hotels. Perfect if you have your own car, it is about 1 1/2 miles from the strip and 1 minute walk to a great casino hotel with tons of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: BlackIslers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in July 2009 and paid only £98 in total... A great big suite (bedroom, living room, kitchen and bathroom. Kitchen equipment was a little sparse though. Had a top floor suite but no lifts unfortunately so getting heavy baggage up was a problem. Room was very hot on arrival and it took about 12 hours to get the temperature down with the air con on full. No breakfast on site - go across the road to the Orleans which is adequate (just) The location is very quiet - most noise on site was other guests and their families. However, we were well away from the pool which is a problem area for noise. Staff were very helpful - security guys were ever watchful.

Reviews.Title: “The best Place to stay while in vegas”
Reviews.Author: sluvsm14
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place. We have stayed here on more than one occasion and will not stay anywhere else. The staff and hotel is perfect in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: audreyrosecanada
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff very accomodating staff for special needs

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Conveniant made my trip a success!”
Reviews.Author: travelerWalter
Reviews.Content: Location was important and this property provided a quiet atmosphere with a very clean room and all the amenities that made you feel right at home. With familiar stores nearby, quick access to major streets and a large popular casino within walking distance, this location was perfect for all my needs. Being able to prepare small meals was a real plus and helped me stay on schedule. I am looking forward to my next business trip and another stay at this facility.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ajwsuncity
Reviews.Content: We stay at Emerald Suites when visiting our son in Las Vegas. We find the location and room setup meets our needs perfectly. Easy access to freeway and surface streets makes travel to all attractions very easy.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel/Apt.”
Reviews.Author: lauriflor
Reviews.Content: Wow!! We loved staying here and want to go back with our kids! It snowed in in Las Vegas and the Airport sent us to Emerald Suites.They picked us up at the Airport in a shuttle, took us to the Hotel where we were treated with the utmost respect and joy-despite the despereate wet, and snowy conditions we were in. For $49.00 a night, west of the strip-closeby, we were so surprised to see it was a SUITE, with an Apartment-like feel to it. A great Kitchen, Dining room, Heater (Yeah!), TWO BIG rooms, a Super clean environment, the Bathroom was just ample enough, extra towels and blankets in the hall linen closet, and in the living room a Huge TV with delivery menus. In the morning we saw it had a pool, laundry, soda/water machines, etc and we walked across the street to "The New Orleans Casino" (HUGE, great restaurants, lots of choices for Casino Playing). There is plenty of parking and they told us it is $appx. $400 a week for a 2 BR. We will definintely be coming back with our whole family!!

Reviews.Title: “Great VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: SoapinTrucker
Reviews.Content: Full blown suites, includes stocked kitchen (no food of course, just the other stuff) , the kitchen comes with pots and pans, dishes, utensils, and coffee pot, microwave, etc! This is a REAL suite, separate bedrooms, separate kitchen and dining! The laundry room is very nice, and the pool is clean and has a jacuzzi! Excellent location, right next door to a casino, VERY close to the strip! A must see to believe deal in LV!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Stay at the Emerald Suites”
Reviews.Author: SactoCyclist
Reviews.Content: Date: Sept. 24-27 The hotel was not quite what we were expecting, but it was okay for the price. However, the lighting in the rooms could be better and it would be helpful if the lamps were plugged into wall sockets that are activated by the light switches. The air conditioning unit made a thumping noise in the plumbing whenever we tried to cool the room down. It sounded like someone was playing bongo drums in the bathroom. The spa was warm, but the jets did not work so it was like sitting in a warm bath. The bath towels were well-worn, which is not terrible. However, it would have been nice to have more than two bath towels since most women use more than one a day (one for wrapping their hair after showering). Also, there were no 'pool' towels, so we had to ask the maids for extra towels or use the ones intended for the shower. The main doors into the buildings could use devices to stop them slamming at all hours of the night. It was very disconcerting to hear the loud banging all night long. The room had internet, but we had no idea how to use it. The front desk staff could not even tell us HOW to access the internet, so we had to find a wi-fi spot every day to log on! Oh...and on our last night, a guest ripped the fire extinguisher box completely off the wall and left it lying on the floor. When I reported it to the front desk upon check-out, she seemed pretty unconcerned. It could just be that she was young, but I would have sent someone out right away to see if any other damage was done. Paying for the full stay in advance was a little disconcerting, too. It makes it difficult to shorten the stay and find other lodging. The location was good. If they can fix some of the issues above, we would consider staying there again. If those problems aren't rectified, we would probably choose to spend a little more to get a working spa and a little more quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: basketballdad
Reviews.Content: We were out in Las Vegas for the weekend for our son's basketball tournament and we stayed at this hotel. The hotel was located just by the tournament, the rooms were clean and spacious, and the staff was very helpful with anything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “"We love to stay here again..Great for family"”
Reviews.Author: paapuCaymanIslands
Reviews.Content: I had booked two rooms in "Tropicana" for 5 days. Stay was very uncomfortable rooms being too far from main lobby and smoking . then we moved to emerald suites in Cameron (2 bed room suite). We 5 (4 plus one infant)family members had a very pleasant stay in emerald suites for 3 nights . We had nothing but regretting for staying in Tropicana We loved everything in this suites. rooms appeared brand new or very recently renovated. We felt as if we are the first people to stay there, as they were so clean . Kitchen is too good, we made best use of it. Free internet (LAN ) and local calls!!! above all the price we paid was very less. Many TV channels including travel channel .In brief, this was much better than the condo we now live in Cayman islands (At least we are paying double the money for last three years ) It takes only 5 minutes to be in "STRIP" ($2.50 bus pass valid for 24 hours, with great connectivity and frequency ). As our flight got delayed , we overstayed for 6 hours for free!!!. And free airport coach!!. all these things were not included in our pricy Tropicana rooms I strongly recommend to stay here , NOT ON THE STRIP in a big crowd

HotelInfo.Name: Emerald Suites Cameron
HotelInfo.Address: 4777 Cameron St, Las Vegas, NV 89103
